definition: Mt Qilian in Qinhai
surname Qi
large/vast
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
surname Lian
surname Shan
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
Qilian Mountains (formerly Richthofen Range), dividing Qinghai and Gansu provinces

sentences.english: It comes from the Qilian Mountain and flows though about 35 kilometers within Jiayuguan.
sentences.chinese: 它发源于祁连山，流经大约35公里进入嘉峪关地区。

sentences.english: Establish 1985, factory address connects hill road in a surname 2651.
sentences.chinese: 创办于1985年，工厂地址在祁连山路2651号。

sentences.english: For the eastern section of QiLian mountain landscape management and landscape planning to provide a scientific basis.
sentences.chinese: 为祁连山东段山地景观管理域景观规划提供科学依据。

sentences.english: The average runoff remained steady basically for many years to many rivers in Qilian mountain regions;
sentences.chinese: 祁连山区许多河流多年均值基本稳定。

sentences.english: The forest change status of the Qilian Mountain during the Qing Dynasty and the Minguo period.
sentences.chinese: 清至民国时期祁连山区森林的破坏变迁状况。

sentences.english: The mountains in the south are part of the Qilian mountain range.
sentences.chinese: 南部高山是祁连山脉的组成部分。

Tianshan mountain range between XinJiang and Mongolia and Kyrgyzstan
Golmud or Ge'ermu city (Tibetan: na gor mo grong khyer) in Haixi Mongol and Tibetan autonomous prefecture 海西蒙古族藏族自治州[Hai3 xi1 Meng3 gu3 zu2 Zang4 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Qinghai
desert
Tsaidam or Qaidam basin (Mongolian: salt marsh), depression northeast of the Plateau of Tibet, located between the Qilian Shan and the Kunlun Shan at the northern margin of the Tibetan Plateau.
Altai mountain range in Xinjiang and Siberia
Yumen Pass, or Jade Gate, western frontier post on the Silk Road in the Han Dynasty, west of Dunhuang, in Gansu
